meanings.definition: The point at which the observer's eye is situated.
meanings.sent1: At the eyepoint, you can see things clearly.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the microscope's eyepoint for a better view.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue hidden right at the eyepoint.
meanings.sent4: His passion for art was the eyepoint of his life.
meanings.sent5: The eyepoint of the camera captured every detail of the scene.

meanings.definition: A point in space from which rays of light appear to diverge.
meanings.sent1: The eyepoint of the laser beam was clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully chose the eyepoint for the perspective in the painting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat chased the laser's eyepoint around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spread like rays from the eyepoint of joy.
meanings.sent5: The eyepoint of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
